headline: GE Aerospace’s Iraq Power Plant Win and Desalination Push Could Be a Game Changer for GE (GE)
summary: GE Aerospace recently secured a contract to build the 3,000-megawatt Al Faw gas-fired power plant in Iraq, which features saltwater desalination technology and includes GE supplying operating gas for the first time in such a project. These developments, alongside new aerospace service agreements and a US$30 million workforce training investment, highlight GE's push into advanced manufacturing and integrated infrastructure solutions across global markets. We'll explore how GE's entry into...

headline: Is GE Aerospace (GE) One of the Hottest Mega-Cap Stocks of 2025?
summary: ​GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) is one of the Hottest Mega-Cap Stocks of 2025. On October 9, GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) announced that its FlightPulse App has seen a 156% increase in the number of commercial and business jet pilot users since 2022. ​The app, which is part of the company’s electronic flight bag, is now being used […]

headline: RTX to Report Q3 Earnings: What's in Store for the Stock?
summary: RTX gears up for Q3 results with rising jet engine demand and robust segment sales, though higher tariffs may weigh on earnings.

raw.headline: RTX to Report Q3 Earnings: What's in Store for the Stock?

headline: AerCap Holdings (AER): Evaluating Valuation Following New Seven-Year Lease Pool Deal With GE Aerospace
summary: AerCap Holdings (NYSE:AER) has secured a seven-year agreement with GE Aerospace to provide lease pool management for the GE9X engine, further expanding its role in managing support for several GE engine types. This deal positions AerCap as a key player as the GE9X engine prepares to enter service. See our latest analysis for AerCap Holdings. AerCap’s new deal with GE Aerospace comes as the company continues a strong run, with its recent one-year total shareholder return of nearly 25%...
